text: Cask at bow... Golden amber.. Small off white head.. Soft sweet floral orange fruit nose.. Dry floral fruit.. Long bitter finish

Ilość chmielu sprawia, że piwo po kilku łykach zaczęło mnie męczyć. ZIołowy zapach chmielu po jakimś czasie zaczął przypominać mi zapach zaschniętej na kolanie spodni kupy po przegranym meczu z chłopakami z sąsiedniej wsi.
Bottle. Bronze with a small head. Pleasantly hoppy with a bitter edge. This bitterness put me off a little. Apart from that its a very pleasant beer up to this brewerys high standard.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden amber pour with a grapefruit and tangerine aroma, taste has exciting tropics with a load of pine, tangerine, well crushable,
Botella de 50 cl en el lúpulo en el momento el 27-03-2015. (R 20) sabores y aromas maltosos con toques afrutados y final amargo no muy intenso. Cuerpo ligero a medio, fácil de beber. Normal.

568ml bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. A slightly hazy amber pour wuth a tight cream head and fine carbonation; aroma of grapefruit and mango; dry in the mouth with a delicate grapefruit and melon taste; developing a slightly more bitter grapefruit finish that is clean, refreshing and very moreish. A rather good single hop golden ale.

500ml bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 14-09-2014.
Shared with Hansen and Zita.
Pours murky orange with frothy whie head, good head retention, some lacing. Fruity, resins aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, fruity, citrusy, Ends dry and somehow fruity. Maybe a bit rough, but still enjoyable.
bottle from Darts Farm. Golden with a white head. Aroma of tropcial fruit. Medium-bodied, good malty flavours plus lots of tropcial fruit from the hops, peach, mango and lychee. Superb.
Great white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lychee and other white fruits. Semi dry taste, fruity, refreshing, some grapefruit. Medium bitterness.
Aromas of watermelon, tropical fruits. Very cloudy golden with smal head. Sweet, medium high bitterness. Quite typical represent of single hop beer.
568ml bottle. Enjoyed @Freiburg (Barcelona). Pretty correct beer. Sorry, my computer is dead. Tasting notes are coming soon!!

Cask gravity at the Just Reproach, Deal, Kent. 12/07/2014. Aroma is lovely, resin, pine needles, light tobacco. Clear golden orange coloured pour with a loose halo of off white head. Flavour is big orange peel, rangerine, spicy piney hop. Palate is semi-sweet resin, medium full body. Really solid beer. So good i ordered a second pint.

The New Penguin, 13/09/14. Pint bottle: bonus point. Brassy honey capped with a loose white foam. Jammy, sweaty hop scent evoking apricot, blackcurrant, tangerine, Rubicon, Darjeeling and tomato stem. Leafy stewed curry leaf mango and blackcurrant-driven hop flavour wafting with Arbors signature excellence. Good underpinning greasy monkey nut malt. Suggestion of passing jazz cigarette. Hopped up but deeply balanced. Fine brew indeed.
light citrus hoppy aroma,amber, cloudy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice citrus hoppy finish.
Amber coloured and unclear. Has a white head, lasting. Hoppy aroma, us-hops, herbal. Hoppy flavor, more herbal notes. Light sweetness too. Bitter finish. Cremy, dry texture.

Had this in bottle, picked up at Jacks Westholme Stores, Goring-on-Thames, Oxon. Consumed at home, Saturday 20th September 2014   Pours a rather grubby looking orangey colour with white a white head. The aroma at furst appears a little muddled but then you get sone fruity hops. Taste is sweet at first but then a steady lazy bitterness floods through, a little citrus then some tropical fruit. Nice.  A7 A3 T7 P4 Ov15 3.6

Cask conditioned at Minehead Beer Festival 14. Amber with white head. There is a fuller malty body to this, biscuity with a hint of caramel, then a full hoppiness with the Mosaic hops, fruity, bitter and lasting. Good stuff.

Bottle. Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Cloudy amber. (Loads of yeast sediment in the bottom of the bottle). Thin, sticky, off white head. Nice, fusty, skunky, orange juice. Taste is jammy sweet, with a fair amount of spicy, light dry bitterness. A little satisfying chew, on the palate. More of the fusty bitterness at the end. Super drinkable. My cup of tea.

28th August 2014Very hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and a little crisp. Light malts, touch of sweetness. Hops start with a light skunk, then mild marmalade, light floral spice and a mild passion fruit. Trace of spicy pine. Light semi dry finish. Pretty drinkable.
Cask at the Hanging Bat. Pours golden, nose is sweet fruit, taste is thin, light toffee, pine.
Cask at The Hanging Bat. Pours clear gold, thick white head. Tropical fruit and grapefruit aromas, light malt. Taste is bitter, some caramel. A little sticky towards the end. Decent.
Gravity at the Hope, Carshalton. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit. Sweet bitter finish.
Cask at Earl of Essex, Islington, London. A dark golden coloured pour with a thin white head on top. Sweet, hoppy, fruity aroma. Tastes similar, sweet, hoppy, fruity, some caramel.

Cask-conditioned at Small bar, Bristol 1/7/2014. Deep gold with a frothy, white, head. Aroma of mango, green herbs and over-ripe stone fruits. Flavour had plenty more mosaic character, with a touch of creamy malts and moderately bitter finish. Enjoyable.
